H0.text: The turning driveshaft causes the wheels of the car to turn.

H1.text: Wheel Line causes the wheels of the car to turn.

H2.text: The once driveshaft causes the wheels of the car to turn.

H3.text: Gear shift causes the wheels of the car to turn.

A4.text: A drive shaft connecting a rear differential to a rear wheel may be called a half-shaft. The name derives from the fact that two such shafts are required to form one rear axle.

A5.text: In front-engined, rear-wheel drive vehicles, a longer drive shaft is also required to send power the length of the vehicle.
